entry.content:
A short testimony

The Lord put me in a Christian family through his mercy.

I loved Jesus, but when I got into high school and then university, I slowly began putting people above God. Jesus became my friend, not my Lord. Because of that, I found myself living two lives: one of partying and chasing the approval of others, and another of church on a Sunday‚Äîif I didn‚Äôt have anything else on.

Sometimes, in the middle of a party, I‚Äôd step outside and think, What am I doing this for? What‚Äôs the point of this? What‚Äôs the point of life? And instead of sitting with those questions, I‚Äôd fill my mind (and my stomach) with meaningless things just to forget the reality of what I was doing.

This back-and-forth went on for a few years. Yes, I love Jesus! Yes, I love partying!  But through Jesus, his forgiveness‚Äîand through so many small Christian groups, clubs, and loyal friendships‚ÄîI slowly started making decisions that put God above people. Gods mercy is so good! 

Why a missionary?

When I truly found Jesus again‚Äîand actually wanted to give Him my degree, my job, my life, and the people I surrounded myself with‚Äîthat‚Äôs when my faith stopped being just a belief and started becoming faith in action.

Reading the Bible no longer felt like a podcast I‚Äôd listen to and forget an hour later. I read it and wanted to live it. I just didn't know how. So when I read,

my response was basically, Okay God!! Please help me to do this, in one way, shape, or form!

During this time, I was deeply encouraged by testimonies at church, and I wanted more. One day, while looking through my grandma‚Äôs bookcase, I found Visions Beyond the Veil. I devoured it‚Äîthrough a lot of tears‚Äîand told God, ‚ÄúI want this to be my life.‚Äù After that, I searched up the author, which led me to Iris Global. I joined one of their online mission schools, and found hearts burning with the same love for Jesus and missions.

After finishing my Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, I moved back in with my parents for a few months to ‚Äúcheck‚Äù whether God wanted me to use my degree in a normal 9‚Äì5 job (to earn money and then go). I applied for countless internships and graduate roles in New Zealand and Denmark. At the same time, I prayed and asked God whether I should stay in New Zealand or go to my mum‚Äôs country‚Äîmy first country‚ÄîDenmark, to reconnect with family and relearn the language.

God answered very clearly: every single job application in New Zealand was rejected‚Ä¶ and He provided a flight to Denmark.

This timing was incredible because I had also applied for the Iris Portugal Harvest School. I spent most of 2025 in Denmark, God gave me a summer cleaning job there to help pay for Harvest School, and He even provided me a remote job so I could travel without constantly stressing about finances. Now, I only sometimes worry! Yay!

I love learning languages, and I love travelling. And I‚Äôve realised that I want to do the travelling that only God wants me to do and with His people. Cool experiences mean nothing compared to knowing Jesus and growing closer to Him.

Going on from that, the book of Philippians is awesome. Here's a verse that's always motivated me:

Why Brazil?

While I was doing my degree, I started Brazilian Jiu Jitsu and quickly realised how much I loved it. 'Doing Jiu Jitsu in it's original country would be awesome', I thought. When I later joined the Harvest School in Portugal, I loved learning Portuguese, and that curiosity for Brazil grew (they speak Portuguese there too, funnily enough). One night at the school, I brought this to God in prayer. I told Him how I felt‚Ä¶ and ended it with, ‚ÄúGod, I want Your will for my life, not mine.‚Äù

I hadn‚Äôt told anyone about this desire. Not a single person.

The very next day, during Sunday worship, a woman I had only spoken to once before came up to me and prophesied over me. And funnily enough, she said that I would speak several languages‚Äîand that I would go to Brazil. WHAT üò≠

Later, when I shared this with the school, the Harvest School leader said he felt God had told him to give his Bible‚Äîprinted side-by-side in English and Portuguese‚Äîto someone.

And now, here I am, reading it!!!!! 

Now what?

My current thoughts:

  • Visit Brazil and their Iris bases, and see which one God wants me in, if any.
  • Been thinking about end of February, or the start of March to visit.
  • I've been wondering if I book a one way ticket, or a return ticket...

Thanks for reading so far <3

P.S. Let me know if any of you guys have anything I can pray for, and I would love prayer as well :)
